alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 24 at 3:55PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Southwest Douglas County Colorado. * WHEN...Until 700 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 355 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated a half to one inch of rain has fallen in the burn area of the 2002 Hayman fire. Steep terrain and remaining flood prone areas of the Hayman burn area could experience minor flooding. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Westcreek.
info.instruction: Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
